description: InParanoid is a program for automatic identification of orthologs while differentiating between inparalogs and outparalogs. An InParanoid cluster is seeded by a reciprocally bestmatching ortholog pair, around which inparalogs are gathered independently, while outparalogs are excluded.  The InParanoid database is a collection of pairwise ortholog groups aiming to include all 'completely sequenced' eukaryotic genomes. By this we mean above 6X coverage, and less than 1% X letters in the protein sequences. Two variants were tested in this study: this one is the high-confidence set including only orthologs with InParanoid's maximum confidence score of 1.0
name: InParanoidCore
